attributes.action: Create a new offence of entering a tax payer's home for the purposes of council tax assessment
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It is not acceptable for the government, our elected representatives, to require "Valuation Office Agency inspectors" to enter our homes and assess our bedrooms and bathrooms, kitchens and living rooms.  This is disturbing and wrong.

In addition, the householder will be required to help them or face a fine of up to £1,000 plus £200 for every day that they refuse to cooperate!  Compare this with the average fine for driving without insurance which is only £150.

This is unbelievable, and totally unacceptable.  Our homes are private.

Please create a law making it a criminal offence for a valuation officer to enter a person's home.

rejection.details: This petiton overlaps with several already in existence - http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/revaluation/
